title: Despite Transition to Endemic Phase COVID-19 Vaccine Mandates Persist in Australia

opengraph.description:
A Sydney, Australia-based law firm reports, despite the reality that imminent COVID-19 threats have come and gone, vaccine mandates Down Under persist across many workplaces across New South Wales with the Premier on the record that they are not easily overturned. Moreover, the Australian Federal Government entertains discussions with the World Health Organization to implement a global vaccine passport.
The basis for social division across every aspect of life from the public sphere to private life, even driving wedges in between family members, the distinct lines drawn were remarkable. While some segments of society (the majority) believed in the collective necessity for mandates, others were highly skeptical about an overreaching state apparatus. These critics, for example, cautioned that the vaccines were not neutralizing vaccines, meaning they did not stop transmission. And formal government mandates for a vaccine that doesn’t stop transmission to third parties are certainly ethically questionable.
